body: It looks like @xvzf has self-assigned! Thanks! I have added the bug label. Let me know if you feel that this is more of a feature request.

issue.title: helm operator: x509: certificate signed by unknown authority
issue.body:
I'm trying to pull a helm chart from a private registry with a self-signed certificate.
Now the helm operator logs this message:
```
ts=2019-01-08T12:13:18.11620482Z caller=chartsync.go:244 component=chartsync info="Start of releasesync"
ts=2019-01-08T12:13:18.173598161Z caller=chartsync.go:340 component=chartsync info="chart download failed" releaseName=umbrella resource=dev:helmrelease/umbrella err="Looks like \"https://helm.example.com/chartrepo/test\" is not a valid chart repository or cannot be reached: Get https://helm.example.com/chartrepo/test/index.yaml: x509: certificate signed by unknown authority"
ts=2019-01-08T12:13:18.173670137Z caller=chartsync.go:249 component=chartsync info="End of releasesync"
```

I've already tried to set the `repository.yaml` as [here](https://github.com/weaveworks/flux/blob/master/site/helm-integration.md#authentication-for-helm-repos) described:

```
repositories:
- caFile: ""
  cache: helm-test-index.yaml
  certFile: ""
  keyFile: ""
  name: helm-test
  password: xxx
  url: https://helm.example.com/chartrepo/test
  username: xxx
```

Does someone know whats wrong or what I've missed?

issue.title: The --insecure-skip-tls-verify flag does not work with --cert-file and --key-file flags

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Categorizes issue or PR as related to a bug.

issue.body:
The `--insecure-skip-tls-verify` flag of `helm repo add` command supposed to disable TLS verification. However, the flag does not work if `--cert-file` and `--key-file` flags are specified.

The `--cert-file` and `--key-file` are used to verify HTTPS client. So it makes sense to use these flags together with `--insecure-skip-tls-verify` if server requires client verification but client does not need to verify server.


## To reproduce

* Configure Helm repo using HTTPS server which requires client verification and uses self-signed certificate
* Try to add repo using the following command:

```
helm repo add --insecure-skip-tls-verify \
  --cert-file <path> \
  --key-file <path> \
  testrepo <https://url>
```

Command fails with the following error:
```
x509: certificate signed by unknown authority
```

Output of `helm version`:
```
version.BuildInfo{Version:"v3.2.0", GitCommit:"e11b7ce3b12db2941e90399e874513fbd24bcb71", GitTreeState:"clean", GoVersion:"go1.13.10"}
```

issue.title: added option --insecure-skip-tls-verify for helm pull, install and upgrade, addresses #7875

labels.name: size/S
labels.description: Denotes a PR that changes 10-29 lines, ignoring generated files.

milestone.description: This is the next stable feature release of Helm 3.

issue.body:
Signed-off-by: Matthias Riegler <matthias.riegler@taotesting.com>
**What this PR does / why we need it**:
Fixes https://github.com/helm/helm/issues/7875

body:
Why this is a draft: Seems like it breaks something with the Kubernetes cluster configuration and I don't know why yet  

```
 ! [lola ~/p/helm] git:(fix_insecure_skip_verify)  go run ./cmd/helm install --insecure-skip-tls-verify test fluxcd/flux
Error: Kubernetes cluster unreachable: Get "https://kubernetes.docker.internal:6443/version?timeout=32s": x509: certificate signed by unknown authority
exit status 1
```
Nvm, mitmproxy also proxies the k8s apiserver, PR is done
It looks like this is resolved, there may still be an issue with helm accessing an insecure k8s cluster, but the repo/charts are good.  Feel free to open a new issue if we need to resolve the latter.
@paulczar issue is closed by a still open PR - I suggest to keep this open for tracking!
merged #8039 just now, so we should be good here.

issue.title: Allow to skip cert verification when adding the chart repo

repository.name: pipecd
repository.description: The One CD for All {applications, platforms, operations}

issue.body:
**What this PR does / why we need it**:
Add insecure option to allow connection to chart repositries with self-signed certificate.

It has passed the test, but I haven't actually configure and run it yet.
I'll do it after Monday.

**Which issue(s) this PR fixes**:

Fixes #

**Does this PR introduce a user-facing change?**:

-->
